events.title: Signing of the Magna Carta
events.description: King John of England puts his seal on the Magna Carta, a charter of liberties that limited the powers of the king and laid the foundation for modern democracy and rule of law.
events.significance: It established the principle that everyone, including the king, was subject to the law and influenced constitutional law worldwide.

events.title: Battle of Bunker Hill
events.description: The Battle of Bunker Hill takes place during the American Revolutionary War, demonstrating that colonial militias could stand up to the British army.
events.significance: Although a British victory, it boosted American morale and intensified the fight for independence.

events.title: Opening of the Trans-Siberian Railway
events.description: The Trans-Siberian Railway, the world's longest railway line connecting Moscow to Vladivostok, officially opens.
events.significance: It revolutionized transportation and commerce across Russia and Asia.

events.title: Croatia and Slovenia Declare Independence
events.description: Croatia and Slovenia declare independence from Yugoslavia, leading to conflicts in the region.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the breakup of Yugoslavia and the Yugoslav Wars.

events.title: Legacy of Genghis Khan
events.description: Genghis Khan dies, having created the largest contiguous empire in history by connecting disparate territories across Asia and Europe.
events.significance: His empire reshaped geopolitics and trade across Eurasia, influencing many cultures.
